abstract: For Gary Rieschel, a longtime venture capitalist, China’s nascent Internet sector was irresistible. He moved to the country in 2005 and started an investment firm, now one of the largest in the region.
snippet: For Gary Rieschel, a longtime venture capitalist, China’s nascent Internet sector was irresistible. He moved to the country in 2005 and started an investment firm, now one of the largest in the region.
lead_paragraph: BEIJING — When Gary Rieschel moved to China in 2005, he was looking to take a break. He had spent two decades bouncing between Silicon Valley and Asia, most recently managing technology investments in the aftermath of the dot-com bust.

headline.main: Seeding China’s Start-Up Scene, With a Nod to Silicon Valley

abstract: What the NFL deal means for cable bills, Christian Bale is assaulted in China, Rick Perry Tebows in Iowa and two notable deaths: Christopher Hitchens and Joe Simon.
snippet: What the NFL deal means for cable bills, Christian Bale is assaulted in China, Rick Perry Tebows in Iowa and two notable deaths: Christopher Hitchens and Joe Simon.
lead_paragraph: The announcement that the National Football League had struck an extraordinary long-term deal with the major networks — $27 billion over nine years — is good news for the league but most likely means the average cable bill will rise again soon, Brian Stelter and Amy Chozick write.
